metadata.key_specifications: Synchronous BOOST controller with peak current-mode control, monolithic synchronous buck LED driver with 4.5V to 65V input range, adaptive on-time average current mode control for constant voltage or constant current output, compatible with shunt FET dimming and LED matrix manager
metadata.applications: Dynamic beam headlamps, constant voltage or constant current LED driving

page_summaries.content:
The TPS92541-Q1 device contains a synchronous BOOST controller and a monolithic synchronous buck LED driver with a wide 4.5V to 65V operating BUCK input voltage range.

The synchronous BOOST controller implements a peak current-mode controller to operate in constant voltage mode. The Boost can be programmed to operate as dual-phase, or three-phase together with other TPS92541-Q1 devices. The output voltage can be programmed using a programmable 8-bit DAC.

The monolithic synchronous BUCK implements an adaptive on-time average current mode control and is designed to generate constant voltage (CV) or constant current (CC) output. In the CC mode, the BUCK is compatible with shunt FET dimming techniques and LED matrix manager-based dynamic beam headlamps. In CV mode, the adaptive on-time control enables high bandwidth operation with fast transient response.

Figure 4-1. PKD Package 48-Pin HTQFP (Top-Exposed PAD) Top View

PIN I/O DESCRIPTION
NAME NO.
PKD ISN 37 O Negative input (–) of BOOST current sense amplifier. Connect directly to the current sense resistor, RIS.
ISP 38 I Positive input (+) of BOOST current sense amplifier. Connect directly to the current sense resistor, RIS.
LGBST 36 I/O BOOST low side gate driver output.

Product Summary.content: The TPS92541-Q1 device contains a synchronous BOOST controller and a monolithic synchronous buck LED driver with a wide 4.5V to 65V operating BUCK input voltage range. The synchronous BOOST controller implements a peak current-mode controller to operate in constant voltage mode.
The Boost can be programmed to operate as dual-phase, or three-phase together with other TPS92541-Q1 devices. The output voltage can be programmed using a programmable 8-bit DAC.

The monolithic synchronous BUCK implements an adaptive on-time average current mode control and is designed to generate constant voltage (CV) or constant current (CC) output. In the CC mode, the BUCK is compatible with shunt FET dimming techniques and LED matrix manager-based dynamic beam headlamps.
In CV mode, the adaptive on-time control enables high bandwidth operation with fast transient response.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 4-1 provides information about the pin functions of an electronic component, including the pin names, pin numbers, input/output designations, and descriptions. The pins PKD, ISN, ISP, and LGBST are described, with details about their roles in current sensing and gate driving for a BOOST circuit.
The PKD (pin 37) is an output pin connected to the negative input of the BOOST current sense amplifier, and it should be directly connected to the current sense resistor RIS.
The ISP (pin 38) is an input pin connected to the positive input of the BOOST current sense amplifier, and it should also be directly connected to the current sense resistor RIS.
The LGBST (pin 36) is a bidirectional input/output pin that serves as the BOOST low side gate driver output.

Packaging Information.content: Figure 4-1 shows the top view of the PKD package which is a 48-pin HTQFP (Heat Transfer Quad Flat Pack) with a top-exposed pad. Table 4-1 lists the pin functions for this package. The package is available as an orderable part number TPS92541QPKDRQ1 which is an active production part in HTQFP package with 48 pins. It comes in a tape and reel packaging with 1000 units per reel, is RoHS compliant, has a NiPdAu lead finish, a moisture sensitivity level of 3 with a peak reflow temperature of 260°C, and an operating temperature range of -40°C to 125°C. The part marking on the package is TPS92541.

The tape and reel information section provides details on the reel dimensions, including reel width (W1), reel diameter, cavity dimensions (A0, B0, K0), pitch between successive cavity centers (P1), and the overall width of the carrier tape (W). It also specifies the quadrant assignment for pin 1 orientation in the tape pocket. For the TPS92541QPKDRQ1 part, the reel diameter is 330.0 mm, reel width is 16.4 mm, and pin 1 is in the Q2 quadrant.

The package materials information section gives the tape and reel box dimensions for the TPS92541QPKDRQ1 part, which has a length of 336.6 mm, width of 336.6 mm, and height of 31.8 mm. It also includes a generic package view image showing the HTQFP package style.

The package outline section provides detailed dimensions and specifications for the PKD package, including the overall package size of 7.2 mm x 7.2 mm, a maximum height of 1.15 mm, and a pitch of 0.5 mm between pins. It also includes notes on dimensions, tolerances, and reference standards. Example board layout and stencil design guidelines are provided for proper assembly and soldering of the package on a printed circuit board.
